servinfo.title: DTC B1511: Temperature Control Actuator (Position Sensor) and/or Its Circuit Malfunction

entry.ptxt: HVAC control module connector “G52” (harness side view)

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Temperature control actuator position sensor signal voltage is more than or less than specified value for specified time continuously.

s1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC using scan tool.

attention3.ptxt: When DTC B1502, B1503, B1512 and B1530 are indicated together, it is possible that “BLK/RED” wire circuit open.

testgroup.title: Position sensor power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect temperature control actuator connector with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to temperature control actuator at “RED/WHT”, “WHT/RED” and “BLK/RED” wire terminals.
If OK, measure voltage between “RED/WHT” wire terminal of temperature control actuator connector and vehicle body ground with ignition switch turned ON.

testgroup.question: Is voltage 4 – 6 V?

testgroup.title: Position sensor power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect air flow control actuator connector with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure voltage between “RED/WHT” wire terminal of temperature control actuator connector and vehicle body ground with ignition switch turned ON.

testgroup.question: Is voltage 4 – 6 V?

testgroup.title: Position sensor power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect air intake control actuator connector with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure voltage between “RED/WHT” wire terminal of temperature control actuator connector and vehicle body ground with ignition switch turned ON.

testgroup.question: Is voltage 4 – 6 V?

testgroup.title: Position sensor power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from HVAC control module with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to HVAC control module connector at “G52-14”, “G52-27” and “G52-21” terminals.
If OK, measure resistance between “RED/WHT” wire terminal of temperature control actuator connector and “G52-14” terminal of HVAC control module connector.

testgroup.question: Is resistance below 5 Ω?

action.ptxt: “RED/WHT” wire open or high resistance circuit.

testgroup.title: Position sensor power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between “RED/WHT” wire terminal of temperature control actuator connector and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is resistance infinity?

testgroup.title: Position sensor power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: Measure voltage between “RED/WHT” wire terminal of temperature control actuator connector and vehicle body ground with ignition switch turned ON.

testgroup.question: Is voltage 0 V?

test1.ptxt: Connect HVAC control module connector with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure voltage between “WHT/RED” wire terminal of temperature control actuator connector and vehicle body ground with ignition switch turned ON.
Disconnect connector from HVAC control module with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance between “WHT/RED” wire terminal of temperature control actuator connector and “G52-21” terminal of HVAC control module connector.

action.ptxt: “WHT/RED” wire open or high resistance circuit.

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between “WHT/RED” wire terminal of temperature control actuator connector and vehicle body ground.
Measure voltage between “WHT/RED” wire terminal of temperature control actuator connector and vehicle body ground with ignition switch turned ON.
Connect HVAC control module connector with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance between “BLK/RED” wire terminal of temperature control actuator connector and vehicle body ground.
Measure resistance between “G52-13” terminal of HVAC control module connector and vehicle body ground.

action.ptxt: “BLK/RED” wire open or high resistance circuit.

test1.ptxt: Check temperature control actuator referring to Temperature Control Actuator Inspection .
